annotationQueue.createDescription: Create a new queue to manage your annotation workflows.
annotationQueue.editDescription: Edit queue to manage your annotation workflows.
annotationQueue.scoreConfigsDescription: Define which dimensions annotators should score for the given queue.

deleteAction.cannotBeUndone: This action cannot be undone and removes all the data associated with this

success.traceDeletedDescription: Selected trace will be deleted. Traces are removed asynchronously and may continue to be visible for up to 24 hours.
success.dashboardDeletedDescription: The dashboard has been deleted successfully
success.evaluatorDeletedDescription: The running evaluator has been deleted successfully
success.defaultModelDeletedDescription: The default evaluation model has been deleted. Any running evaluations relying on the default model will be inactivated. Queued jobs will fail.

permissions.noAccess: You do not have access to this resource, please ask your admin to grant you access.
permissions.limitReached: You have reached the limit ({current}/{max}) for this resource at your current plan. Upgrade your plan to increase the limit.
permissions.entitlementRequired: This feature is not available in your current plan.

errors.projectAccessDenied: The project you are trying to access does not exist or you do not have access to it.
errors.authErrorDefault: An authentication error occurred. Please reach out to support.
errors.contactSupportIfUnexpected: Contact support if this error is unexpected.
errors.ensureCorrectRegion: Make sure you are using the correct cloud data region.
errors.unableToCheckSso: Unable to check SSO configuration. Please try again.
errors.passwordResetNotConfigured: Password reset is not configured on this instance
errors.traceNotFoundMessage: The trace is either still being processed or has been deleted.
errors.noObservationsFound: No observations found for this trace. The trace may still be processing or has been deleted.
errors.noAccessToTrace: You do not have access to this trace.

trace.sharedDescription: This {item} is public. Anyone with the link can view this {item}.
trace.privateDescription: This {item} is private. Only authorized project members can view this {item}.

session.notFoundMessage: The session is either still being processed or has been deleted.
session.noAccess: You do not have access to this session.

annotate.title: Annotate
annotate.apiEvalVisible: API and eval scores visible on left. Add manual annotations above.

comments.title: Comments
comments.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this comment?

settings.title: Settings
settings.transferOwnershipDesc: Transfer this project to another organization where you have the ability to create projects.
settings.deleteProjectDesc: Once you delete a project, there is no going back. Please be certain.
settings.posthogDesc: We have teamed up with PostHog (OSS product analytics) to make Langfuse Events/Metrics available in your Posthog Dashboards.
settings.mixpanelDesc: Integrate with Mixpanel to sync your Langfuse traces, generations, and scores for advanced product analytics and insights.
settings.blobStorageDesc: Configure scheduled exports of your trace data to S3 compatible storages or Azure Blob Storage. Set up a scheduled export to your own storage for data analysis or backup purposes.
settings.slackDesc: Connect a Slack workspace and create channel automations to receive Langfuse alerts natively in Slack.

auth.signInTroubleshoot: If you are experiencing issues signing in, please force refresh this page (CMD + SHIFT + R) or clear your browser cache.
auth.oauthAccountNotLinked: Please sign in with the same provider (e.g. Google, GitHub, Azure AD, etc.) that you used to create this account.
auth.resetPasswordEmailNote: You will only receive an email if an account with this email exists and you have signed up with email and password. If you used an authentication provider like Google, Gitlab, Okta, or GitHub, please
auth.emailSent: If an account exists, you will receive an email shortly.

dashboard.feedbackDescription: Your feedback matters! Let the Langfuse team know what additional data or metrics you'd like to see in your dashboard.
dashboard.modelCostDescription: Calculated multiplying the number of tokens with cost per token for each model.

emptyState.traces: Traces contain details about LLM applications and can be created using the SDK.
emptyState.scores: Scores evaluate LLM quality and can be created manually or using the SDK.

traces.title: You don't have any traces yet
traces.description: Traces show you how your LLM calls behave in your application: what they cost, how they perform, and where things go wrong. It's the first step towards improving the behavior of your app.

sessions.title: You aren't using sessions yet
sessions.description: Sessions let you group traces that belong to the same workflow, or conversation.
sessions.guide: To start using sessions, you need to add a sessionId to your traces.

prompts.title: Get Started with Prompt Management
prompts.description: Langfuse Prompt Management helps you centrally manage, version control, and collaboratively iterate on your prompts. Start using prompt management to improve your LLM application's performance and maintainability.

decoupled.title: Decoupled from code
decoupled.description: Deploy new prompts without application redeployment, making updates faster and easier

editInUi.title: Edit in UI or programmatically
editInUi.description: Non-technical users can easily edit prompts in the UI. Developers can optionally update prompts programmatically via the API and SDKs

performance.title: Performance optimized
performance.description: Client-side caching prevents latency or availability issues for your applications

compare.title: Compare metrics
compare.description: Track latency, cost, and evaluation metrics across different prompt versions

scores.title: Get Started with Scores
scores.description: Scores allow you to evaluate the quality/safety of your LLM application through user feedback, model-based evaluations, or manual review. Scores can be used programmatically via the API and SDKs to track custom metrics.

collect.title: Collect user feedback
collect.description: Gather thumbs up/down feedback from users to identify high and low quality outputs

modelBased.title: Run model-based evaluations
modelBased.description: Use LLMs to automatically evaluate your application's outputs

track.title: Track quality metrics
track.description: Monitor quality metrics over time to identify trends and issues

custom.title: Use custom metrics
custom.description: Langfuse's scores are flexible and can be used to track any metric that's associated with an LLM application

evaluators.title: Get Started with LLM-as-a-Judge Evaluations
evaluators.description: Create evaluation templates and evaluators to automatically score your traces with LLM-as-a-judge. Set up custom evaluation criteria and let AI help you measure the quality of your outputs.

automate.title: Automate evaluations
automate.description: Use LLM-as-a-judge to automatically evaluate your traces without manual review

measure.title: Measure quality
measure.description: Create custom evaluation criteria to measure the quality of your LLM outputs

scale.title: Scale efficiently
scale.description: Evaluate thousands of traces automatically with customizable sampling rates

track.title: Track performance
track.description: Monitor evaluation metrics over time to identify trends and improvements

annotationQueues.title: Get Started with Annotation Queues
annotationQueues.description: Annotation queues help you manage manual annotation/labeling for your LLM projects. Create queues, define annotation metrics, and track progress.

manage.title: Manage scoring workflows
manage.description: Create and manage annotation queues to streamline your scoring workflows

collaborate.title: Collaborate with annotators
collaborate.description: Invite team members to annotate and evaluate your LLM outputs

track.title: Track annotation metrics
track.description: Monitor annotation progress and quality metrics across your team

baseline.title: Baseline evaluation efforts
baseline.description: Use annotation data as a baseline to evaluate your other evaluation metrics

datasets.title: Get Started with Datasets & Experiments
datasets.description: Datasets in Langfuse are collections of inputs (and expected outputs) for your LLM application. You can run Experiments against these datasets to test new releases before deployment to production.

continuous.title: Continuous improvement
continuous.description: Create datasets from production edge cases to improve your application

preDeployment.title: Pre-deployment testing
preDeployment.description: Benchmark new releases before deploying to production

structured.title: Structured testing
structured.description: Run experiments on collections of inputs and expected outputs

custom.title: Custom workflows
custom.description: Build custom workflows around your datasets via the API and SDKs, e.g. for fine-tuning, few-shotting

datasetItems.title: Add items to your dataset
datasetItems.description: Datasets are collections of specific edge cases and underrepresented patterns used to evaluate your application.

uploadCsv.title: Upload CSV
uploadCsv.description: Import dataset items from a CSV file

addViaCode.title: Add via Code
addViaCode.description: Use our Python/TS/JS SDKs or custom API

selectTraces.title: Select Traces
selectTraces.docDescription: Creating items from production data is supported on single trace level. Click to view docs for more details.

datasetItems.noAccess: You don't have access to this feature, please contact your administrator

users.title: You aren't tracking users yet
users.description: Once you add a user ID to your traces, you can correlate costs, evaluations and other LLM Application metrics to better understand how they interact with your LLM applications.
users.guide: To start tracking users, you need to add a userId to your traces.

playground.title: Playground
playground.helpDescription: A sandbox to test and iterate your prompts across multiple windows
playground.configureModelFirst: Please configure a model in Project Settings first

noModelConfigured.title: No Model Configured
noModelConfigured.descriptionPart1: To use the playground, you need to configure a model first. Go to
noModelConfigured.descriptionPart2: to add an LLM API key and configure your models.

traces.title: Tracing
traces.helpDescription: A trace represents a single function/api invocation. Traces contain observations. See docs to learn more.

sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.helpDescription: A session is a collection of related traces, such as a conversation or thread. To begin, add a sessionId to the trace. See docs to learn more.

users.title: Users
users.helpDescription: Attribute data in Langfuse to a user by adding a userId to your traces. See docs to learn more.

columns.userIdTooltip: The unique identifier for the user that was logged in Langfuse. See docs for more details on how to set this up.
columns.firstEventTooltip: The earliest trace recorded for this user.
columns.lastEventTooltip: The latest trace recorded for this user.
columns.totalEventsTooltip: Total number of events for the user, includes traces and observations. See data model for more details.
columns.totalTokensTooltip: Total number of tokens used for the user across all generations.
columns.totalCostTooltip: Total cost for the user across all generations.

datasets.title: Datasets
datasets.helpDescription: Datasets in Langfuse are a collection of inputs (and expected outputs) of an LLM application. They are used to benchmark new releases before deployment to production. See docs to learn more.

scores.title: Scores
scores.helpDescription: A scores is an evaluation of a traces or observations. It can be created from user feedback, model-based evaluations, or manual review. See docs to learn more.

prompts.title: Prompts
prompts.helpDescription: Manage and version your prompts in Langfuse. Edit and update them via the UI and SDK. Retrieve the production version via the SDKs. Learn more in the docs.

annotationQueues.title: Annotation Queues
annotationQueues.helpDescription: Annotation queues are used to manage scoring workflows for your LLM projects. See docs to learn more.

evaluators.title: LLM-as-a-Judge Evaluators
evaluators.helpDescription: Configure a langfuse managed or custom evaluator to evaluate incoming traces.
